channel.title: Ultimate User Scam!
channel.description:
If you want somebody to think that there computer is stuffed READ HERE. If you don't please exit this page.
Follow the steps given to complete the task: 1) Go to your desktop and click PrintScrn (Located next to the F12 key and the Scroll Lock key). 2) Go to paint and click CTRL+V or right click and select Paste. 3) Save the picture as any name (Must be in .BMP format). 4) Delete all desktop items. 5) Right click the Taskbar and select Properties. 6) Make sure that the 'Auto-hide Taskbar' is ticked. 7) Go to desktop and right click. 8) Select properties then go to the 'Desktop' tab. 9) Choose you desktop picture as the one you saved before in paint. 10) Log off and enjoy!
----
This is supposed to make the user think that the computer is stuffed. e.g When the user clicks on an icon it doesn't work. When the user tries to go to the start menu it won't pop up.
Etc. Etc..

item.title: Ultimate User Scam!
item.dc:creator: @bumr055 bumr055
item.description:
@bumr055 wrote:

why not … unlock the taskbar and manualy shrink it out of sight… and then lock it again… and recycling bin is useless right click it and go to “properties” and find where you can disable it or “don’t use recycling bin, just delete files” and i think the icon will dissapear after that.

Read full topic

item.title: Ultimate User Scam!
item.dc:creator: @dudeofthed dudeofthed
item.description:
@dudeofthed wrote:

If you want somebody to think that there computer is stuffed READ HERE. If you don’t please exit this page.

Follow the steps given to complete the task:

  1. Go to your desktop and click PrintScrn (Located next to the F12 key and the Scroll Lock key).
  2. Go to paint and click CTRL+V or right click and select Paste.
  3. Save the picture as any name (Must be in .BMP format).
  4. Delete all desktop items.
  5. Right click the Taskbar and select Properties.
  6. Make sure that the ‘Auto-hide Taskbar’ is ticked.
  7. Go to desktop and right click.
  8. Select properties then go to the ‘Desktop’ tab.
  9. Choose you desktop picture as the one you saved before in paint.
  10. Log off and enjoy!

This is supposed to make the user think that the computer is stuffed.
e.g When the user clicks on an icon it doesn’t work. When the user tries to go to the start menu it won’t pop up.

Etc. Etc…

Read full topic
